Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for the Pearson Airport”
Reviews.Author: Irwin_Vroom_Family
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel because of the rate for one overnight stay and 7 nights of parking during our trip to Jamaica in February 2012. The check in was smooth, the staff was accomodating. The room was very comfortable for me and my 2 boys (11 and 10) and we enjoyed a quick sleep before departing in the morning. The bag breakfast was not great, but it was provided at no extra cost so it is hard to complain about something free.... The shuttle driver to the airport was helpful and got us there quickly. The best aspect of this hotel as a park and fly hotel is the convenience to the 401 at the end of our trip. We landed at 7pm, cleared customs by 740pm and were in our car driving home to Ottawa by 8pm. Extremely satisfied with this hotel and WILL stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Room is great, desk attendant was horrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: chebryry
Reviews.Content: Everything was great with the exception of the lady who checked us in. Rude! Snotty! Talked down to us. Seemed to be a task for her to give us the information we required.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: enercontrol
Reviews.Content: Once again, we chose to stay here upon returning from our yearly Cuba trip. We stayed here before our trip and upon returning. Both stays were uneventful and enjoyable. Check in was at 2 AM on our return and we were in our rooms in 7 minutes. You can't ask for better than that! The restaurant, which I've criticized on previous occasions, had a great breakfast and the service was superb. The rooms, and for that matter, the whole hotel, was clean and very quiet. Rooms are adequate for a night's stay and certainly for a good price. The location is right next to the 401 Hwy which gives you a short hop to most locations in Toronto. Downtown can be a short 20 minute trip. While there are no other facilities within walking distance, there is lots within a short drive. And don't forget to ask for your 'Gaming Package' while there. $25 worth of chips for the local slots for each of you! We managed to parlay $60 in coupons into $160 of cash the last time we were there! I have stayed here frequently and it's still my hotel of choice when I go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: I_want_sunshine
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel (January 2012). We found the check in to be very quick, well organized and helpful. Watch when you sign your bill though, as they almost charged us more than our quote, until I pointed this out. The room was comfortable, clean, had a coffee pot, tea, bottled water and a couple granola bars. We called earlier in the day of our arrival to make sure our shuttle to the airport was booked for the following morning requirements, and all worked out well. . They even provided us with a bag breakfast to take with us to the airport. We were pleased that we could park our car in the lot behind the hotel for the week while we were away. Shuttle pick up on our return from the airport was quick and no problems experienced. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock4891
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. I got back to the hotel around midnight and as I stepped off the elevator I was hit with a cloud of Marijuana smoke. The entire floor was filled with it. I got to my room and could hear doors slamming people yelling and swearing down the hall. I looked out the peep-hole and caught a glimpse of who I was sharing a floor with and knew I was in for a long night. I woke up at around 2 am to the sound of more yelling, swearing and slamming of doors. Several calls to the front desk failed to put a stop to the disruption that was happening. Then a fight broke out in the room beside me and I could hear one person being severely beaten. After this the individuals proceeded to absolutely trash the room they were staying in. I felt as if they were going to come through the wall of my room at any moment. I am not exaggerating when I say that my girlfriend and I were scared for our safety. The police finally showed up (about 5 hours after I had first called the front desk) to forcibly evict these people. They had to call an ambulance for the individual who had been attacked who was barely conscious. So I ended up falling asleep around 8am and had to be up at 10am to check out The hotel did refund my night but I will still never stay at a Quality or any of the Choice Hotels ever again. The hotel acted very irresponsibly by renting rooms to people paying cash and not even bothering to check up on the floor they were staying on. They also brought in several guests which were not part of the original booking and would have walked right past the front desk staff on their way into the hotel. A simple check of the floor once would have revealed the rampant illegal drug use that was taking place. Instead the staff left it up to me to report what was going on in their hotel. As I said earlier, these people looked like bad news and the fact that they would rent them a room period is of particular concern. The reason I stayed here was to rest up after a trip before making a 5 hour drive home. Instead I got about 2 hours of sleep then had to drive home exhausted putting our safety at risk. I would have got a better sleep in the airport or my car. If I can convince even one person from patronizing this hotel I will be satisfied..

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN >:(”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just one p--s off after another. Stayed here the night prior to going on vacation down south. Web site claims on site parking(not true...you have to park 5 blocks away then get a shuttle back to the hotel) and 24 HOUR SHUTTLE SERVICE TO AIRPORT. We booked with our credit card but paid the $111.36 (that was clearly stated on our booking confirmation that I printed off) in cash when we arrived, we were charged a $200 deposit on the room bringing the total to $311.36 which was fine. When we returned to the hotel after parking our vehicle, I asked if we could get a wake up call for 2am as we had to be at the airport at 3 to check in for our flight, to which point the girl at the front desk informs us that their 24 HOUR SHUTTLE SERVICE TO THE AIRPORT DOESN'T START UNTIL 3:15 AM!!!! The next morning we go down to check out: the girl looked at us and said "Ok, the cost of your room was $119(something) plus tax so we owe you $174(something).....ummmm, WHAT??? When I showed her my confirmation that the room was $111.36 she said "Well that is a mistake and whoever checked you in should have noticed that" when we told her we were not paying a dollar over what was on our confirmation she then tried to tell us that there was tax on the deposit and tried to blame the girl who checked us in again for not telling us that. When we told her it was not our problem that the person checking us in did not inform us of the tax (which we knew was absolute crap) she finally agreed to give us the full 200.00 deposit back but not before turning to her co-worker and saying "I wish they would stop posting the wrong price on the website" So first she tries to place blame on the individual who checked us in, then proceeds to claim that prices posted on their website are inaccurate...make up your mind, lady!!!! And as for making it to the airport 3 hours before our flight.....we arrived at the terminal at 3:45 to catch a flight that boarded at 5:20...not impressed, not impressed AT ALL

Reviews.Title: “room great shuttle not so great”
Reviews.Author: Rachel L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean and a resonable price the shuttle to the airport was great however on the way back I Called the hotel at 10:20pm when I got into the airport the receptionist was told me to go to C22 and wait their would be about 20 min. so my family and I went to washroom and preceeded to gate C22 we saw the shuttle go by us as we walked their. after 20min I called the hotel to ask if we missed it the receptionist said again just wait at C22 they will be their I said one went by us 20 min ago she said we have 4 at the airport just wait. finally at 11 20 another shuttle came but it only had 3 seats left we were four. The driver said we would have to wait for the next one at least a half hr more. we were so cold from standing outside in -5 degree temps for a hr. finally the driver came back at 11:54 we got into the shuttle and he had a airfreshner hanging off his seat my husband removed it because I am allergic to scents however I still suffered an astma attack when the driver realized I was not breathing very well he drove quickly to the hotel and I got what I needed. The driver told us the one driver was told their was a pick up but when he got to c22 no one was their so he was at end of shift and just went to finish his rounds. I think he should of done what the other shuttles did and ask people with suitcases where they were going not just driving by them. I also think their should be more than one shuttle when it is winter when people are coming from 95 degree weather to -5 it's not good to be standing their for a hr and a half. now my husband and 1 daughter are both sick it was not a good end to a beautiful vacation. The driver did give me a good tip however he said next time send one person out to wait for shuttle while the other people wait in the airport and stay warm. (rock paper scissors anyone?)

Reviews.Title: “Sent here by Air Canada after missed connection”
Reviews.Author: TribecaFoodie
Reviews.Content: Waited about 15 minutes for shuttle at Pearson. Lots of confused people at the shuttle stop because there are so many Quality hotels near the airport, each with its own shuttle. Hotel is a 15 minute ride from the airport in a rather grim area beside the 401 highway. Shuttle driver was irritable. Arrived around 11:15. Check-in went smoothly. They had 60 "distressed travellers" from Air Canada that night. Other people checking in were upset because the complementary morning shuttle to the airport were already full (booked first-come, first-serve) and so they had to pay for a taxi themselves or leave at 4:00 a.m. for an 8:00 flight. Walked into hotel restaurant to check it out and because I had a dinner voucher from Air Canada. Other patrons laughed when I entered and told me to forget about ordering food since they had been waiting an hour for a plate of nachos. Headed up to my room on the 11th floor. Basic 2* room with double bed and gross-looking couch. Noisy from television in adjacent room (could hear every word). Toilet leaking and so it would start running every few minutes with a roar of rushing water. Elevator gonged throughout the night too. Overall not recommended but since I wasn't paying I can't really complain.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service once again!”
Reviews.Author: schnoobs
Reviews.Content: Once again my husband and I stayed here on the night before our trip to Cuba. I have to say the staff are starting to feel like family! We arrived the day before our flight and were greeted so warmly by the front end staff and they moved us from our original room because they had a hockey tournament group and didn't want our sleep disturbed because we had an early morning flight. We checked in and went to the restaurant in the hotel lobby for supper and the hotel manager seated us and chatted with us for a moment, ( extremely pleasant man )had a wonderful supper ( spagetti and pizza) and had a very peaceful night sleep. Beds are extremely comfortable. Shuttle service is always on time and friendly driver as well. Takes about 10 minutes to get to the airport. I recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to have a wonderful experience at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, good quality”
Reviews.Author: FredCana
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in this hotel after a long trip from Greece. There was a special on the net for this hotel, I only paid $58 including the tax, even lower than the B&B's in Toronto. This is an airport hotel, so there is nothing much interesting around. It's a very suburban area, far away from downtown. The hotel is a quality hotel. I liked the design of the rooms, styled in a classical way. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. I did not like the breakfast. When I came to the breakfast lounge, the waitress told me that she will serve herself. She asked the drink I want and the bread type. Then she brought me the breakfast plate. The plate was almost all sweets except the butter and I had no other option. There were no cheese or eggs. I don't think it's good to start the day with this much load of sugar. I noticed that some other people were having breakfast plates with eggs, bacon etc. Then I thought it's because of the reservation I made. But still, option has to be given and extra money could be requested for a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: farmerpeteo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! convenient location, good value clean, comfortable rooms, great staff, excellent breakfast. We have chosen this Quality Suites Hotel on several occasions and have always been happy. It is our favourite Park and Fly hotel. Fay McCann

Reviews.Title: “don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Melanie P
Reviews.Content: paid over $ 40 more than quoted when booking through hotel. hotel shuttle took 1 hr to pick us up from our return flight. not worth the $

Reviews.Title: “Improved Since I Was Here Last !!”
Reviews.Author: enercontrol
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here and must say that things have improved since I was last here. The rooms are still spacious and the rooms, halls and entrances were spotless. The staff at the Front Desk were friendly and even supplied us with a Gambling Package that gave both of us $25 in chips to play slots at Woodbine. That $50 sure helped lower the cost of the room. There is some noise on the 8th floor from aircraft but it is not bad and very short lived. We didn't have the opportunity to visit the restaurant this time, but hopefully the service has improved. There is no 'free buffet breakfast' at this hotel! Travelling by car, the whole of Toronto is at your beckon and in 20 minutes you can be downtown, at the other end of the city, or just about any where you want to be. The location, right off the 401, is very convenient. And the price is right! This is my location when I come to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap through Hotwire.......”
Reviews.Author: TonyJudge
Reviews.Content: Like other Tripadvisor customers, we booked through Hotwire and only paid Â£29. We had laready had a full day in Niagara Falls so were only using this hotel as a base for the night as we had an early flight out the next morning. Had heard that Toronto taxis were expensive so used teh subway and 192 Skyrocket to get us to teh airport, then phoned the Quality Inn for a free transfer. Be careful as there are two Quality Inns near the airport!! Rooms were OK clean and comfortable. Transfer to/from the airport took approx 10-15min so very easy. Ate at the pub next door - food average but there was no other choice. Good location if you are flying in or out immediately, but not good for access to Toronto Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: gaye151
Reviews.Content: At midnight someone tried to enter our room. We were never given a proper explanation or apology . I did ask to speak to a manager the next day. Although pleasant he was a new evening manager and did little to alleviate our concern. He offered us a free dessert. We did leave a hotel review with a request for someone to contact us. We have not heard a word. We only stay at this hotel as we have a small dog. The rooms given to dog owners are less clean and need updating. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access and large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: drew0911
Reviews.Content: This property has large clean rooms and easy access to all of Toronto. We got this hotel off of hotwire at 50.00$ a niht and they advertise for 110.00. So anywhere closer to fifty makes it a great value. Free internet and the bar and restaurant were good and reasonable. Clean and friendly and right on the bus line as well

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management Response”
Reviews.Author: RarelyaReviewer
Reviews.Content: Extremely loud male in adjoining room verbally abusing a female...loud yelling for about 1/2 hour. Manager and security came to check and warned patron. Loud noises continued. Next morning, persistent loud knocking on door of that same room at 5:15 a.m. Loud and rude hotel patron who has no idea at all how to behave in a public setting can make for the most unsettled and unpleasant experience that a hotel guest can have. What would you have done in my shoes?

Reviews.Title: “Experience that I was Privileged to Have”
Reviews.Author: Evan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel in September. The Hotel is outdated but the staff was great, Both the restaurant and front desk The restaurant neeeds a makeover but I found that the food was freash and good quality. The dinner I had when I got there was really good. I would recommend to give it a try. The breakfast wait staff and management was a pleasure to deal with although the restaurant was packed they still attended us in a quick and professional manner. The breakfast was good and love the china. I suggest if you want the bang for your buck with nice amenities..... check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, rancid food”
Reviews.Author: CHMOORE30
Reviews.Content: Save your money, and go somewhere else. This hotel is far from any restaurants or shopping. Though there is a restaurant in the hotel, I don't recommend that you eat there; we had to return the food since it smelled absolutely rancid. I mean, we couldn't even stand the smell of it on our table! The rooms are very dated and aren't very clean. Passable but barely. Let's put it this way, I wouldn't have company over if my house were this dirty. The neighbourhood is less than desirable as well... definitely not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times in the last 6 months”
Reviews.Author: AlTheComputerGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is priced well. But the rooms are very inconsistant. Some rooms are clean with new furniture, refridgerators and microwave ovens. Others are just the opposite. Because I was a "regular" the people working the counter got to know me and were very nice and friendly. They do seem to have a lot of turnover at the front desk, so sometimes there is a little confusion. The internet is really slow. It is OK for email, but if you need to use a VPN, it is probably too slow. The business center is a little room with a single PC. The restaurant was OK, but nothing special. The people working as servers were very good, and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: tina m
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport, Short walk to wal-mart. very friendly staff. Even the 2 shuttle drivers were excellent. Very clean. only problem, internet was a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: mainetobuffalo
Reviews.Content: It's not so much what's wrong with this hotel, but there is nothing great about it either. Bed was of motel 6 quality, carpets had a few stains, and building in general is dated. Service was adequate, and the location is not near anything commercial, and well outside the city. On the bright side, there was free parking which is unusual for an airport hotel in the area, and the hotel did serve its purpose as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WILL NOT BE RETURNING..DIRTY,,UNPROFESSIONAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: While I was a guest at this hotel...I found the staff too pretty much have no idea what they were talking about, the room was a mess, the fire alarm went off numerous times, the restaurant was a complete mess held down by the most uncomfortable manager...whom just kept eyeballing all the women guests in an awkwardly unprofessional way, the hotel is in a dingy neighborhood with absolutely nothing near by..stay anywhere but here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: dwright21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before an international flight at Pearson. Not impressed. Before arriving, I called and confirmed that I could "park and fly" and this was included in my room rate. When checking in, I was informed that its not covered because I booked through an on-line source. The only was I could park there was if I paid for another whole nights stay. Needless to say, I wasn't happy and we made other arrangements. The desk staff were not helpful and the service was not so hot (cleanliness, coffee containers empty, etc.). Also, although relatively close to the airport, there isn't much around the hotel. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: bed bug infested, dirty bed that is warped.”
Reviews.Author: Alanditt
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have stayed in. Found hair on my sheets and pillows. Woke up covered in bed bug bites. Temp was stuck on 18c, could jot be changed, was broken. Manager told me they don't clean sheets if the look clean. But told me I can change room. No clue how this is a 3 star. Never again. Nasty dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a standard hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: ottawatraveler86
Reviews.Content: Staff was professional and courteous, high level of cleanliness and tidiness, Clean quality linens. Rooms are a bit dated but fuctional. Only complaint is the bed was a bit worn out. Nothing special, but a decent and clean place to sleep. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “American Airlines put me up here”
Reviews.Author: trippy051
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine: nice clean rooms, good facilities, free computer for use by guests, average or OK restaurant. It's relatively convenient to the airport, and there is a free shuttle service. However, there is nothing of interest in the immediate area, so it's for people with some business in the area, or airport stopovers, and that's about it. Most of the other guests I encountered were, like me, 'guests' of American Airlines, staying there because of canceled, delayed, or missed flights. Even though it is right in the takeoff path from the airport, the sound insulation is reasonable, and my night's sleep was not disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Always coming Back”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey05
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this Hotel for 3 years now at least 10 times a year when I visit Toronto on business, Always take a business room. Rooms are Clean, Staff are all friendly and if there is a problem they will take care of it. No problems to ever report and I will be staying here for all my future biz trip to Toronto. Free Internet , Free Parking and Restaurant has excellent menu with plenty of selections which keeps me at the hotel for Breakfast and Dinner. I have gotten to know most of the staff from my periodic stays and they are always happy and Cheerful. This Hotel is my number 1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean and easy”
Reviews.Author: adavici
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't really anything special to write home about, but it was fine for a quck, cheap place to crash in Toronto. It's a little out of the way, out by the airport and not downtown, so not the most convenient, but the price was the priority on this trip. My room was on a high floor looking NE and I had a nice view. The room was quiet and the noise from the airport wasn't any issue like I have experienced at other hotels near airports. It was clean and spacious. A bit worn and in need of renovation, but not filthy or anything. This is a case of a good-enough middle of the road hotel. No real complaints or praises!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mathura29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn this past weekend. This hotel is located in a great area where you can find the local highways as well as a variety of stores and shops close by. The front desk staff were nice especially Samantha who made our check in easy and quick and answered all of our questions...THANK YOU! the rooms are pretty basic but clean and despite the bad reviews this hotel was great and included free parking and internet. I look forward to staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and average”
Reviews.Author: Shnoopsy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from Hotwire for the free airport shuttle service. Shuttle was great and on time, driver was friendly BOTH ways. After booking and reading reviews i was aware that there was no food service after hours and just my luck the vending machines were out of order so i couldn't even get a bottle of water on the hottest day of the year. Front dest offered me a cup of tap water, but I just went to my room without. Was delighted to find a complimentary bottle of water and granola bar in my room at 1am, that just made my night!! A/C was a little loud, and cable TV was fuzzy but that would be my only complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: enercontrol
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on a number of occasions and continue to use it whenever we're in Toronto. The location means that you are never more than 30 minutes drive to anywhere in the Big City! We found the service, rooms and staff to be super. However, avoid the restaurant! The food is mediochre and the service at times is terrible! It used to be real good but it has deteriorated lately. Their Park and Fly program is an excellent deal. Room and parking for a week + for $98. Parking alone can cost you $85 at the airport. All in all, we will continue to make use of the hotel whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable with FREE parking!”
Reviews.Author: beastleys
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful at checkin and out and when we asked for extra coffee. Older hotel, but rooms were clean, and beds had light yellow bedding so no hidden stains. Convenient to the airport.. only 10 mins away. The only issue was with early check outs... you could hear people in the hallways as they were leaving. Great bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home...I'm made to feel most welcomed!!”
Reviews.Author: Silverfox211
Reviews.Content: Being away from home for extended periods I look for hotels that provide me with the comfort, service, and necessary amenities similar to those at home. The Quality Suites Airport East meets that challenge. The personal attention and service provided by everyone, from the front desk staff, the service and housekeeping staff, restaurant staff and management, makes each stay a pleasant and relaxing one...it's my home away from home!! I would highly recommend the Quality Suites Airport East, especially for the seasoned traveller, as my repeated stays hve shown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money”
Reviews.Author: sylvie_travel
Reviews.Content: We booked on the phone directly and got an excellent rate. When we arrived at the airport, the shuttle showed within 10 minutes; the driver was very helpful and friendly. Our check in was very smooth even while it was very busy. Our room was comfortable and clean. As we traveled with our small dog, we used room service, which was very fast. The food is good. When there was noise in the hallway from a group of young guests, the staff immediately corrected that. When we requested a late check out, again, the staff was very accomodating. Is there room for improvement, sure (the airco is rather noisy), but for this price it is already a great deal. We were a bit worried after reading previous reviews, but we've been very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality at the Quality Suites”
Reviews.Author: travellerman69
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for the last 7 years and the room is consistantly clean, front desk friendly and efficient. On my arrival they even googled a map for me to make it to my meeting the following day. They have upgraded their high speed interenet so connection is fast and doesn't go down. Even though I arrived at 9 pm it still gave me time to have a late dinner in the restaurant, the food either breakfast or dinner has always been good .

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: spudster72
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with this hotel at all and would not stay here again. It was dirty and the front desk staff were not friendly at all during check in and check out. The shuttle service is terrible with one poor man driving the van and getting paged by the hotel every 5 mins asking "where are you?" The hotel stated that the shuttle runs every 15 mins which is not possible as it takes 15 mins just to get to the hotel from the airport. I was suppose to stay at this hotel on the way back, but quickly changed to a Sheridan hotel. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “If you bring your car, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sven-289
Reviews.Content: If a deal seems too good to be true it probably is. Got a great rate online for this hotel for a one-night stay. Was told they had free parking. What they didn't tell me was that at 6am they were going to tow my car out on the street where I got a Ticket. Front desk person told me to park in front of an Air Canada sign, which I did, but what they didn't tell me is that there are two sets of Air Canada parking spots less than 40 feet away from each other and I guess I picked the wrong ones. I've stayed at other hotels in this area and did not have this hassle. There must have been 200 empty spaces in the lot, but they decided to dump my car on the street. Apparently the hotel only has the rights to a limited number of spots and the other buildings in this complex WILL tow you if you park in the wrong place. Took talking to 3 employees to find my car and none of them felt what they did was unreasonable? Other than that, the room was ok. Bed and room could use an update, but worth the price I paid. Of course with the Ticket, its about the same price of the Comfort down the road. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerman41
Reviews.Content: On business I've been to many hotels, this hotel treated me well with a friendly smile on check in and a thank you on check out, haven't had that in a while. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the updated wireless internet was easy to connect to and consistant. I grabbed a quick bite in the restaurant before i left and it was good food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Shika24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel on Islington Ave, thinking it was plush .. not only was service horrible, I ended up getting bitten by bed bugs. I asked to get my room change and it was the same story.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing: noise, poor location, shuttle unreliable at best, service”
Reviews.Author: miked004
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to be sentenced to this hotel by an Air Canada delay. It has the unique distinction of being the only place I have ever stayed with all of airplane noise, train crossing noise, and highway noise, but with no real sound proofing. The shuttle left us standing on the curb because it was full; estimated wait time was "25 minutes, if I can get in another trip before my shift ends." We took a cab. When I complained, they said "sorry, the shuttle is complimentary". The wireless internet was free, but incredibly slow: page loads took a minute or more. The only option they were able to offer for food (room service closed at 11pm) was a pizza place. In a city of 5 million people, they had no other options. The hotel furniture, decor, and trimmings are aging badly, though everything was clean and worked.

Reviews.Title: “Drafty and Old”
Reviews.Author: lpptom
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were pleasant and helpful. The room was quite small and cramped. We had a corner room which was cold and the heater was not adequate. At night you could feel the cold air on your feet. I was disappointed that there was no refrigerator or microwave in the room. More surprised to find out that a microwave rental was $10.00 per day and the hotel places a $50.00 per day hold on you credit card for incidentals. Wireless internet frequently dropped off. Parking is free which was a bonus. The price and situation was right for the time.

Reviews.Title: “Outworn hotel and very poor service”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt recommend this hotel at all. I stayed there for 2 nights this september and even though I booked it with hotwire for a very good rate it wasn't worth it. We arrived late in the evening and called the hotel for the shuttle bus around 11pm. They told us the shuttle will be at the airport in 15-20 minutes. After 40 minutes we called again and they told us to wait another 15-20 minutes owing to a change of the drivers shifts...in my opinion they simply forgot us. When we finaly arrived at the hotel and went to the reception desk the receptionist didn't even looked up to us and of course there wasn't an apology at all for the mess with the shuttle. She was even rude when we complained. Otherwise the hotel is outworn, not very clean and just ugly, but thats probably not such a surprise for a 2-star airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay in a very peaceful area”
Reviews.Author: elvis4life
Reviews.Content: This hotel that I stayed in was in a very peaceful & quiet area with great service. My only complaint was that it was a bit far from Downtown Toronto, however you can take a bus 1 block away from the hotel to the Islington train station, which'll take you to where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except very loud noise at night.”
Reviews.Author: pieeee
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel overall, but there wasn't any pool. It was a pretty good location near the highway which made it pretty fast to get into the city. But when you went to bed there was a whole lot of noise a t night. People were talking loudly in the hallway almost all night it was terrible we couldn't sleep. There wasn't any breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: heatherall
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with hotwire, as a place to stay, and leave our car as we were flying out for a holiday. After reading some other reviews, we were prepared for the worst. Upon check in we were upgraded to a "business" floor room. Our room was spacious, and very clean. We requested a mini fridge, and one was brought up to our room for us. Staff was very pleasant. The shuttle to and from the airport was great. The location is a little out of the way (for restaurants and shopping), but no problem if you have a car. Free internet was a plus. The restaurant at the hotel was nothing fancy, but had good food.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks so bad!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkey222
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and do not book here!!! If the weather is good grab a cardboard box and crawl in it, at least you will know what to expect!!!! We booked here a month before arriving and were told no problem, upon arrival we were told that they had no booking for us and no rooms, I stood my ground and demanded a room which funny after about 20 mins of arguing suddenly a room was found. We were told when we booked that there would be a cot no charge but they wanted 10 dollars for the cot, I refused. There was A lot of foreign talk going on behind the counter (i can imagine what was being said!!!) Finally we get our romm, very basic, no cot for a half an hour, call to the desk... they forgot...20 mins later the crappiest cot I have ever seen shows up. Who cares tired of fighting, I sleep on the cot so my daughter can sleep with my wife... I wouldnt expect my dog to sleep on the cot. Park and fly you leave your car in a dark poorly lit parking lot behind the hotel no security.. Ok I'm done just go anywhere else other than this place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: y2imm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located farther from the airport than other equally priced hotels, and is not within walking distance of restaurants. I didn't try the onsite restaurant. The hotel states it was recently renovated but that is hard to believe, it appears to be several years old, not bad mind you, but definitely not sparkling new. It is clean however. The airport shuttle is complementary, but runs on a poor schedule compared to others, while waiting for the shuttle I saw other hotel shuttles make repeated stops, very frustrating. The wireless highspeed is adequate. I didn't try the breakfast buffet. There is another Quality hotel much closer to a variety of restaurants which can be had for a similar price on bidding sites. I rate this hotel as accetable only if you do get a good discount on a room via these websites, otherwise not a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and convenient for a one night air stayover”
Reviews.Author: ewriting
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed with the hotel when we got to our room.... the price we paid was cheap and the room was adequate for a place to sleep on a flight layover. The shuttle service was wonderful and convenient. The first driver was ok but did not appear to like his job much. The driver the next morning was like a breath of fresh air - he was happy and enjoyed his job very much. He also dressed and acted very professional. The rooms are small compared to what we had been used to. The room was very warm and it was difficult to get it cooled without one of us having to deal with a fan almost by our heads. The carpets were dingy. The water for bath/shower was just barely warm and the tub could have been cleaned better. There was banging and noise from other rooms throughout the night and we did not have a very safe feeling. The front desk on check in was very efficient; however the front desk clerk the next morning was a little icky. As I was waiting for him to end a phone conversation he coughed and a big piece of gob came out. He made no attempt to cover his mouth and just allowed the gob to fall on the counter. It sort of turned my stomach. The restaurant --- very good. We got in later and even though the restaurant was getting ready to close they prepared great meals for us and others that had arrived late. The food was good, fresh and tasty at a reasonable price. I would not stay at this hotel for an extended period of time. Would I stay again? probably not even though the price was low. They indicated that it has just went thru renovations which is incredible - I would hate to see what it looked like before.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: natmicstef
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through hotwire for $47 per night; a true bargain as the rooms were a nice size, clean and had all the amenities you would expect including free wireless internet, free parking and free shuttle which some hotels in the area do charge for. Hotwire had our reservation booked under my first name so it took a while to sort out whether we had a reservation or not but all went smoothly after that. We had breakfast one morning in the hotel's restaurant; somewhat expensive for a very simple buffet. We enjoyed our stay; it was not a Days Inn type experience which you might expect for this price; delighted by the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingyNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times now and find it to be in a great location, relatively good value and very well maintained. Our only complaint is the parking situation...there are only a couple of spots available at the front of the building so most of the time you have to park behind the building with no rear entrance available but at least they don't charge for parking unlike other hotels. There is a restaurant in the building but we don't eat there because it seems fairly expensive and most of the time we just want something simple. We will definately stay there again when we are back in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and policies”
Reviews.Author: Travellingpair12
Reviews.Content: We were flying to Cuba and booked hotel on a website offering a Park and Save price of $90.00 including taxes if you stay at the start or end of your trip. I booked a room and sent a separate email confirming it was a non smoking room and that we would stay at teh end of our trip. The email was replied to advising it was a non smoking room. We live 3 hours from Toronto and arrived 3 1/2 hours before our flight time. The hotel was one of the furthest away from the airport but the other hotels charged $135.00 to park and fly. On booking in we were told the $90.00 was not from their website and must only have meant free overnight parking. They advised tha actual park and fly rate was $135.00 which was the same as everyone else. I asked if that included the shuttle and we were advised it did and the shuttle would be there in 5 minutes. I booked the room by credit card and then was told the shuttle would be at least a half an hour. Not wanting to cut our arrival that close we took a cab at a cost of $20.00. The day before we were to return to Toronto, we got a message that there was a death in our immediate family. We were not scheduled to land in Toronot until 1:00 am the following day and just decided that we would drive straight home. I found the Quality Suites website on the internet in Cuba and cancelled the room several hours before our cut off time. We received a confirmation of the cancellation by email while in Cuba. We landed at the airport and the shuttle was not there so took a cab at a cost of $28.00. I went into the hotel to pay for the week's parking and was advised we would have to pay full price of $135.00 as they are not in the business of selling parking. We explained our situation and that we had cancelled the room and we were told to take it up with the manager tomorrow. I did contact the manager and supplied the website that the original booking was made from and sent a copy of the email we received confirming our room cancellation. I suggested we pay the $90.00 for parking or pay the $135.00 and be refunded my cabfare.The manager advised she would investigate but came up with the same resolution that they are not in the business of selling parking. Staying at this hotel cost me a total of $183.00 including my cabfare, clearly the worst deal in Toronto. It would have been almost as cheap to take a cab from home to and from the airport. We had stayed at the hotel before but never again. J. Dore

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cheap and comfortable!"”
Reviews.Author: funonthecheap
Reviews.Content: We got an exceptional deal on this hotel on Hotwire for a weekend of sightseeing in Toronto. Didn't expect much but were pleasantly surprised. The staff was professional and friendly. Rooms were clean, spacious and beds were comfy. Free, easy parking a definite asset. The location was not convenient to any tourist attraction in particular, but close enough to the highway to make it convenient to come and go to a subway stop. I've stayed here before on a stopover and the airport shuttle was reliable and quick. But this time we stayed for three nights and really appreciated the hotel. Room service was tasty as was the (somewhat pricey) breakfast buffet. Restaurant service was great and we really enjoyed the quiet of the hotel and the cleanliness. Recommend for a budget traveller looking for a three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: eighty5diamonds
Reviews.Content: I would like to share my recent experience at this wonderful hotel. As soon as I had arrived at the hotel, I was welcomed with a warm smile and greeting. I was served at reception without delay and was on my way up to my room within minutes. The room was better than expected. I had a spotless room with plenty of space and was better than advertised. There is one particular event that occurred that made my experience here memorable. As I was heading out of the hotel one day with my spouse and mother, we had asked a gentleman in the lobby of the hotel a few questions about the city and such. Not only did he help answer all of our questions, but he took the time to help plan our day including what part of the city to see and how to get there. It is this type of customer service that has made it easy for me to recommend this particular hotel to my friends and family when they visit Toronto. I most certainly took his name and would like take this opportunity to acknowledge Majid Jaffari as a true gentleman and an asset to the Toronto Airport East location of Quality Hotel and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Total inconvience”
Reviews.Author: beachboundtravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the park and fly option and to have a night's stay at the end of our vacation. I called to confirm my room with hotel over the phone ahead of time. It took 20 mins on the phone to find it. I asked if I should book the airport shuttle, they said no. Got to the hotel at 11:00am. Took 20 mins to check me in. They told me they might fit us in on the 12 pm shuttle but it wasn't guarenteed. Our flight was at 2:30, we couldn't risk not getting the shuttle until 1pm! They said the shuttle runs only every hour. Every other hotel that I have used this service, it was pretty much on demand, or every 15 mins. We had to take a taxi and pay $20 out of pocket. When we returned at 2am the following Saturday, we had to wait 30 mins for the shuttle to pick us up which was ok. Rooms were fine, but service was slow and I will not use them again. There are many more hotels in the area with better service, better amenities, etc. at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: lazee_j
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and was tricked into its elegance and staff. When i got into the room, i was told at check in that I had been upgraded to a business class room on the 11th floor. I went into the room, put my suit case down and was ready to settle into my bed. As i turned the sheets, i see a bed bug on my bed. I was frightened and disturbed that I called down and no one would answer the phone. I called my people, and made reservations else where. Would i recommend this place to anyone? No, its filthy and not worth the money anyone spends there.

Reviews.Title: “Just so, so - not terrible but signficant problems”
Reviews.Author: JohnTheBear
Reviews.Content: Location: Close to 401 and airport yet at least the high floor we were on is quiet. Not near rapid transit so not a good choice if you want to leave your car at the motel. However, parking is free. Very little in the line of restaurants in the vicinity. You can either go closer to the airport, or drive down Islington and turn east on Bloor to Bloor Village West, where there are a lot. Amenities: As a previous reviewer mentioned, internet service sucks. We had the managment call the provider and while there was slight improvement it was generally not at an acceptable level. Hence we would strongly recommend that business travelers need high-spped access stay away. Rest of the hotel is pretty basic, and restaurant is very dull and artificial looking. We only stopped there for one overpriced brreakfast. Cleanliness: Despite generous tips, housekeeping got lazy duing out five night stay and stopped vacuuming our room. Overall, this would be an okay choice for tourists with a car or for people like us using reward points from Choice Hotels. It should be avoided by both business travelers and those looking for a hotel in an interesting area, if not necessarily downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rude service, dirty room!”
Reviews.Author: evanescencetabby
Reviews.Content: We will never go back here! We have stayed here a few times before just for one night before we leave on vacation and this year was the last! They refused to honour our internet bought hotel and parking saying that we did not buy parking for the week even though we did. Wouldnt refund as its not thier problem (which ok maybe it was and when we phoned redtag got a very rude guy who wouldnt help) So they wanted us to pay 80 dollars to park for the week! Even though they sell it for 40 more than what we payed and cant give us that because it wouldnt be fair. They were extremly rude about it and made me cry (i am pregnant and when i get worked up it happens) We are not hard people to please at all but the way we were treated was bad. We then decided instead of giving them more money we'll park at park and fly. Couldnt get a refund on our room so had to stay. Its farther from the airport and for the price they want for parking and the night you might as well pick somewhere closer for the same. Our room was dirty. The carpet was really clean but the bathroom was gross. There was a stain on my sheets. We will never stay here ever again nor recommend it to anyone. They are so rude, even the manager and we really tried to be nice about it!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional staff and especially the sales manager”
Reviews.Author: toni58
Reviews.Content: Because of the unprofessionalism of the staff and especially the sales manager, this was a total turn off to not stay at this hotel. The manager kept changing the price of the rooms and we felt like he did not want our business. So we took our business to the Holiday Inn where we were treated more professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover Experience/Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel on January 16, 2009 for a one night stopover prior to a very early flight. Room, shuttle and 8 days parking was CAD $99 plus taxes for a total of CAD $112. Staff: everyone was friendly and efficient - from Sunny at check in who arranged a wake up call and dashboard documentation for parking, to the cleaning lady who held the elevator door open for me, to the check out staff and night auditor who gave me a newspaper at 3 a.m., to the restaurant staff, to the shuttle driver. Facilities: an upgraded room and bathroom that were spotless. The only small issue was a somewhat noisy heater that struggled successfully against minus 20 C temperatures outside. Restaurant: welcoming with decent food at decent prices for an airport hotel. Airport Shuttle: to manage a large volume of passengers with early morning flights, the hotel had a number of free taxis waiting in addition to the van service. On our return, the van was prompt and the operator courteous. Anyone who expects 5 star accomodation would be advised to go elsewhere and pay triple the price. For us this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: ElPerrazo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is remotely located with no food services nearby. The hotel restaurant and bar are "dead" and overpriced. Brace yourself for the smoke smell in the elevator and don't assume you will get Internet connectivity. You won't. Very dated interior with a consistently uncaring and surly front desk. Avoid this place like the plague. There are plenty of options much more conveniently located near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dakCork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in September. Checked in and everything seemed fine. Rooms were worn but spacious & public areas seemed basic but ok. The area was very quiet, nothing in walking distance but fine if you have a car. Our problem was that when we pulled back the bed clothes to get into bed on the 1st night we discovered that the sheets had not been changed after the previous guests, they were badly stained. We contacted reception & were told that someone would come and change them. About 20 mins later we got a phone call from reception to tell us to go down & collect a key for another room. This meant that we had to get dressed again, go down to reception, stand in line for reception for about 10 mins, then get a key, go back upstairs, pack all our stuff again & then move rooms (remember this was around midnight). We asked to speak to a manager and were told that there was no manager on duty but that they would inform the manager of the issue in the morning. The following morning, we asked to speak to a manager & again were told that there was none on duty and the girl did not know that we had a problem or that we had moved room. I asked for someone to contact us about the incident but we never saw a manager during our stay, I asked again on check-out to speak to a manager but again there was no-one available !! I would not recomend this hotel as a clean bed is a very basic thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special; convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Bought this 3star hotel room on Hotwire for US$62 (incl taxes/fees). Drove to it and checked in at 1 am, so perhaps that's why my experience was better than others. I did see the old van they call an airport shuttle. This Islington & 401 hotel, with14 floors, is easy to find even at night. Didn't seem to be anything you could walk to nearby. Check in was prompt, attentive, and friendly. Staff give you a piece of paper that you must put on dashboard to avoid ticket/tow. Parking is free (rare for airport area) and generally well-lit. There was another guest trying to convince front desk staff that since their dogs were hypo-allergenic, she should have a non-smoking room. Staff did not bend the rules. Elevator smelled smokey, as did another floor when I got ice. Ice machine on some floors, snacks and $1.25 canned pop machine on some others. Room had 2 double beds, table and two chairs, closet (with a hard-to-open door because of the carpet height) with iron & board and two collapsable/portable luggage racks. Four bin long dresser. TV was fine, but no tv checkout. Coffeemaker with Van Houtte coffee. Two generic but okay prints above the headboards. Window coverings - on a window that partly opened - were sheers and blackout drapes. Heat/air controlled by wall thermostat. Items that were new in the room: bedspreads, drapery, muted wallpaper, telephone. Items modern - but not 'new' - included the room carpet and the bathroom tubsurround with curved rod. Light fixtures are old but adequate. No concerns with the beds. Bathroom is adequate size. Counter space a bit limited. Towels just average quality. No book in the room describing hotel services. I did see a room off the lobby with one computer. Noticed the restaurant sign. Didn't see the fitness. I was surprised with the lack of traffic noise overnight, especially since it's next to the hwy. This is an average hotel, but much better than the Quality Inn Airport West (Ambler Dr, near Dixie & 401).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: doalan
Reviews.Content: We were VERY happy when we checked out of this hotel, knowing we would never have to return. To be fair, we were traveling with our small dog which meant we had to stay in a smoking room. Even though they assured us beforehand we wouldn't notice the smoke, the bedspreads, curtains and walls reeked of smoke. The carpet may have been replaced recently, but the furniture, fixtures and bathroom had not been renovated in years. The light fixture over the bed was particularly bad and didn't even have a light bulb when we arrived. The side chair fell apart when we moved it. We were there four nights (stuck with a pre-paid reservation) and the smoke alarm in our room went off several times while we were there. We eventually figured out it was any time we took a shower. The first time was pretty scary, but we eventually just plugged our ears or left the room. We called the front desk when it happened the first time and they didn't seem to be concerned. They said they'd send someone to our room, but no one ever showed up. I hope their service is better in a real emergency. Someone turned several of the hallway lights sideways one night and it was three days before the staff ever fixed them. Service as a whole in the hotel was nearly non-existent. When we'd ask the cleaning staff about the missing light bulb, for example, they just said it wasn't their responsibility. The price of the hotel may be reasonable, but we would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, but OK for budget travellers.”
Reviews.Author: vinigmartins
Reviews.Content: Average hotel with bad service. There is no one to help you with your luggage. The rooms are a little old, but comfortable. They have a cable TV with good channels. The room and bathroom were clean. The girls at the front desk never say hello to you. Sleep there if you don't have to stay there along the day, since they have no recreational activities. The location was good (near the airport, Wal-Mart, McDonalds, etc.). The great advantage is the parking lot. It's free!!! The wireless internet is another positive point.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: colorful_fish
Reviews.Content: One of many choices around Toronto Airport for staying overnight, this is one that I won't recommend. Their claim is that they had a recent renovation, but that was limited to the optical appearance judging by the bathroom fixtures and other amenities. The hotel is pretty far away in comparisson to others, therefore it is cheaper. There was no breakfast included, would have cost approx. 10 dollars per person. Service at this place is basic at best. The complimantary shuttle service dropped our luggage just on the drive in front of the hotel, just to rush inside to continue chatting with the staff at the reception. We were travelling with a kid and a lot of luggage and some assistance would have been great. But there was a large sign in the van that they would accept tips. For what? All the staff did what they had to, but not a bit more. I know I am a romantic, watched probably too many movies from the 40's playing in Grand Hotels, but my idea about the service industry is still, that there should be some service, not just processing you. With all the alternatives in the area I would definitely look for a different option next time. FOR THEIR STANDARD OF SERVICE I ONLY GIVE THEM ONE POINT.

Reviews.Title: “what hospitality is all about”
Reviews.Author: princeofwalesLagos
Reviews.Content: It was and will for a long time be a wonderful time spent in canada based on my experience at this hotel. I have stayed in several hotes all over the world but going by my experience at this hotel I wold say that it was a good experince not in the list the . the staffs were so wonderful especially their sales manager named majid, there is nothing this person did not due to make sure we enjoyed our stay with themm. In many aspect we are grateful to God and all the members of staff. Yours, Prince

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Barry2929
Reviews.Content: Very bad experince at this hotel. We were there for a Christmas party, and booked the suite for the night. When we got there, and checked in (after a 20 minute wait at counter), we got to our suite. Well, instead of a suite, we got a room with an ajoining bedroom. How is this a suite. We expected something with a living area, and all we got was 2 bedrooms with 2 king sized beds. I wish they were more upfront on the website. Breakfast was cold, and greesy, and the whole hotel was freezing. Will not be returning

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: strawberrytwinkles
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Quality Inn for 4 nights from June 29 to July 3, 2004. Overall it is an average hotel. There was free parking at the back, so you have to walk around to go to the entrance. The staff was helpful. Our room was clean. It is a decent hotel if you don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Not very close to the airport!”
Reviews.Author: SueKA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights on either end of a trip out of country. There is a park and fly deal for free parking. The shuttle was overloaded on the way to the airport, even with a reservation, so I had a nice expensive cab ride and no change left for the cart at the airport. The restaurant needs a makeover and the menu isn't very extensive. Breakfast is the best meal and the dinners taste like high-end frozen dinners. The room was quite nice and the bedding was great. It's fine for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Zion
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Quality for 5 nights 2 adults and 2 kids. Room was very small, not comfortable (no space for toiletry bag in bathroom!), clean. In our room we did not have things we needed traveling with little baby (microwave, fridge, ..). Location is next to nothing. Parking is on the back and you have to walk around building to get into lobby. Very uncomfortable. Electronic key was not working on second day. Had to reprogram it. Service was fine, particularly in the hotel bar. Donâ€™t expect anything fancy in this hotel. Overall the Quality is good choice only for a business traveler or for overnight in the airport area, but nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Basic Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Bill_NY
Reviews.Content: I needed a clean and quiet place to stay overnight after a vacation in Mexico. This hotel was convenient to the airport, and offered me a comfortable stay at a great price. I booked through priceline.com, and was very pleased with the rate. The hotel seems quite new, and the room's furnishings showed no wear at all. The carpet in my room looked brand new. The hotel has a tiny fitness facility -- just a standard hotel room with a universal gym where the bed would be. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, but still quite close to the airport. It has an attached restaurant that I didn't try, but it looked nice. Free wifi access is available. This hotel isn't fancy, but if you want basic, clean, comfortable, and quiet accomodations, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, affordable, stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we left for a 2 week holiday. Rate included 2 weeks parking and a shuttle to/from the airport. The food in the restaurant was good ... service was good ... return shuttle was quick to pick us up!

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel & Suites Airport East
HotelInfo.Address: 2180 Islington Avenue | At Highway 401, Toronto, Ontario M9P 3P1, Canada
